bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from C. A. Weckerly to Laura Armistead Carter, December 17, 1926

div1.p: Weckerly writes Carter that the drawings for maps to be used in the History of Yellow Fever are ready and asks for further instructions.

div1.head: Letter from C. A. Weckerly to Laura Armistead Carter, December 17, 1926
div1.opener:
Book
Maps
UNITED STATES
DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR
GEOLOGICAL SURVEY
WASHINGTON
Dec 17/26
Main 1880
Miss Laura Armistead Carter
School of Hygiene and Public Health
615 North Walfe St
Baltimore
Md.
Dear Miss Carter:=
div1.p:
The outline drawings for one of
your maps is ready for superimposing the date you
have to go there on.

My last word from Dr Morley was
a request to have them by this Friday and I believe
he was to take them to someone here in Washington for
some alteration

I learn from the Carnegie Institution that
Dr Morley has left town for the Winter, so kindly advise
me as to your wishes regarding the maps.
div1.closer:
Very Truly Yours C.A. Weckerly Room 5217
Interior Bldg.
